summary: a man stands on a clump of land on hokkaido island , japan . geologists believe the emergence is a result of a landslide nearby . the mass has risen some 30 to 50ft above sea level , measures roughly 1,000 - 1,640 ft long , and 100ft wide . the extra stretch of coastline has risen as high as 50ft from the sea surface .

a man stands on a clump of land on hokkaido island , japan . geologists believe the emergence is a result of a landslide nearby . the mass has risen some 30 to 50ft above sea level , measures roughly 1,000 - 1,640 ft long , and 100ft wide . the extra stretch of coastline has risen as high as 50ft from the sea surface .
aspect: 1. 1,000ft seabed forced to the surface overnight in Hokkaido, Japan.
2. Landslip near Rausu caused by melting ice and snow.
3. New coastline measures 1,000-1,640ft long and 100ft wide; no further expansion expected.
explain: An unprecedented phenomenon occurred in Hokkaido, Japan, when a 1,000-foot seabed was forced to the surface overnight, leading to the emergence of a clump of land that rose 30 to 50ft above sea level. Geologists attribute this event to a massive landslide in the area.
A landslide near Rausu is likely caused by melting ice and snow, which is responsible for the emergence of a clump of land on Hokkaido Island, Japan.

The newly formed clump of land in Hokkaido, Japan, measures 1,000-1,640ft long and 100ft wide, and its coastline has risen up to 50ft from the sea surface. The formation is believed to be a result of a landslide, and there is no further expected expansion.
